controlled_vocabulary.comment: This table provides the restricted vocabulary for the column quantity series type in the table Experiment Set and is used to describe the main parameter that defines the focus of the experiment

term.name: heat
term.description: the experimental variable is an increase in temperature above the organism's normal range

term.name: cold
term.description: the experimental variable is a decrease in temperature below the organism's normal range

term.name: salt
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in the salt concentration outside the organism's normal range

term.name: light
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in the amount of light

term.name: nutrient
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in concentration of an important nutrient, such as glucose

term.name: chemical
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in concentration of an exogenous chemical. This differs from drug or toxin in that the chemical is not directly harmful to the organism, but modifies the expression pattern of the organism. It is different from nutrient in that it is not required for the organism's survival.

term.name: toxin
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in concentration of a toxin, such as kanate

term.name: drug
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in concentration of a drug, such as an antibiotic

term.name: water
term.description: the experimental variable is a change in the amount of water
